x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.potential_impact: A digital platform can encourage responsible e-waste recycling by allowing people to locate drop-off centers, schedule pickups, and track collected items. It promotes sustainability awareness, reduces landfill pollution, and enables recycling companies to reuse copper, plastic, and electronic components safely—helping build greener communities.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Electronic waste (e-waste) is one of the fastest-growing global waste streams. USB cables, chargers, and small electronics are often improperly discarded, causing toxic landfill waste and environmental damage. There is no simple system for communities to responsibly dispose of e-waste and track its recycling journey.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: CableClean – Smart E-Waste Collection & Recycling Network

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

We want to have modules like ServiceNow Customer Service Management (CSM), Service Catalog & Request Management, Field Service Management (FSM), Integration Hub, Performance Analytics 
  

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Technical Dependcies like QR code scanner integration for tracking e-waste bags and Integration with Google Maps or OpenStreetMap API is must for Field service agents for proposed solution

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Challenges are Lack of public awareness about e-waste hazards and campaign against using this USB cables and Need for partnerships with local recycling centers are impleentation challenges.
